info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:26PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Lincoln and northwestern Flathead Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 424 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 20 miles west Whitefish, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Heavy Rain SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Rexford, Trailcreek, Stryker, Olney, Lupfer, Trego, Radnor and Fortine. This includes Highway 93 between mile markers 135 and 186. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
